en.purpose: To detect Infective Endocarditis (IE) for patients with widely disparate clinical features that make it harder to diagnose.
en.use:
The Duke Criteria tool should be considered in patients with suspected IE under the following criteria:

  • Prolonged Fever of Unknown Origin.
  • Fever and vascular phenomena (stroke, limb ischemia, physical findings of septic emboli)
  • Persistently positive blood cultures (2 or more)
  • Patients with prosthetic valves who are febrile
  • Injection drug users who are febrile
  • Patients with a pre-disposing heart condition who are febrile
  • Fever with a recent history of hospitalization

The classification groups are:

  • Definite
  • Possible
  • Rejected

Definite:

  • One or more Pathologic criteria, or
  • 2 major criteria, or
  • 1 major and 3 minor criteria, or
  • 5 minor criteria

Possible:

  • 1 major criterion and 1 minor criterion, or
  • 3 minor criterion

Rejected:

  • Does not meet criteria of Possible, as above (There are also several clinical presentations that influence the choice to reject a diagnosis of IE, which can be read in (1)).
en.misuse: This tool should not be used in isolation of clinical presentations that assist to classify IE in patients suspected of suffering from the disease and it should not be used in those who have had previous treatment with antibiotics.

gt0001.description: Diagnostic criteria to diagnose and stratify patients suspected of having infective endocarditis (IE) into definite, possible, and â€œejected. Should be applied to patients in whom there is a high clinical suspicion of IE. This tool allows high predictive detection of Infective Endocarditis (IE) for patients with widely disparate clinical features that make it harder to diagnose.

gt0006.description: Demonstrated by culture or histologic examination of a vegetation, a vegetation that has embolized, or an intracardiac abscess specimen.

gt0007.description: Vegetation or intracardiac abscess confirmed by histologic examination showing active endocarditis.

gt0008.description: Typical microorganisms consistent with IE from 2 separate blood cultures, microorganisms consistent with IE from persistently positive blood cultures, single positive blood culture for Coxiella burnetii or antiphase I IgG antibody titer >1:800.

gt0009.description: Echocardiogram positive for IE, abscess, new partial dehiscence of prosthetic valve, new valvular regurgitation. Note: Worsening or changing of pre-existing murmur NOT sufficient.
